title.rendered: Multan vs Karachi, Pakistan T20 League 2023: Pitch Report, Fantasy Team, Probable Playing XIs, Fantasy Tips

content.rendered:
Pitch Report for Multan Cricket Stadium

Venue: Multan Cricket Stadium, Multan

(Based on the last three games)

1st innings average score: 170

2nd innings average score: 152

Wickets per innings: 6

Type: Good for batting

Wins

Batting 1st: 66%

Batting 2nd: 33%

Fantasy Team for Multan vs Karachi

We have opted for a fantasy cricket team based on the recent performances, overall impact, and credit points.

Probable Playing XIs

Multan: Shan Masood, Mohammad Rizwan (c & wk), Rilee Rossouw, David Miller, Kieron Pollard, Khushdil Shah, Carlos Brathwaite, Usama Mir, Abbas Afridi, Ihsanullah, Mohammad Ilyas

Karachi: James Vince, Matthew Wade (wk), Haider Ali, Shoaib Malik, Irfan Khan, Imad Wasim (c), Ben Cutting, Akif Javed, Mohammad Amir, Imran Tahir, Aamer Yamin

Also Read:

Quetta vs Lahore, Pakistan T20 League 2023: Fantasy Tips

UAE vs Namibia, CWC League: Fantasy Tips

Fantasy Tips of The Day

In four games at Multan this season, Mohammad Rizwan has accumulated 219 runs at 73, including three half-centuries.

Rilee Rossouw is the second-highest run-scorer (189 at 95) in this edition. In the process, he has blasted 23 fours and seven sixes at the venue.

By virtue of taking 12 wickets in only four games at Multan, Ihsanullah is the highest wicket-taker in the competition.

Such has been Kieron Pollard’s consistency in the format that he has featured in the Best11 in six of the last eight games.

Mohammad Amir has taken 9 wickets, including the best figures of 4 for 25 against Multan.

At Multan, Shoaib Malik has collected 365 runs at 31, including the highest score of 71*. For the season, he has smashed two fifties in four games.

Although Imad Wasim has added only 68 runs and picked six wickets in 10 outings against Multan, his recent form makes him a valuable pick: he has been a part of the Best11 for three out of his last four games.

After four games, Usama Mir is yet to go wicketless. In this period, he has taken 8 wickets at Multan.

By bagging eight wickets, including the best figures of 4 for 22, Abbas Afridi has made the Best11 for three consecutive games.
